intro: Synurus, commonly known as the false lily of the valley, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asparagaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are perennial herbs with showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plants typically have linear or strap-like leaves and are often found in woodland or shaded areas. Synurus species are characterized by their fragrant flowers and their ability to thrive in moist, well-drained soils. They are sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to their aesthetic appeal.
